summary_md: This round clarified a precise gap between the archived O(log* n) speedup (Theorem A, Lemma 1–2, Corollary A) — which is correct for the order-robust r-local sequential model that reads B(v,r) and writes only at v — and the stronger “Online-LOCAL(t)” model used in ICALP’23. Two useful restricted variants were proposed and connected to the archived proof: (i) output-only Online-LOCAL(t) (arrived vertices fix immutable outputs and send messages that depend only on graph + those outputs in B(v,t)), and (ii) t-local-dependence (v’s decision depends only on arrived subgraph and fixed outputs in B(v,t)). Lemma O1 / Bridge lemmas show these restrictions imply an order-robust sequential r-local rule (r=t), hence the archived O(log* n) result applies. A minimal counter-scenario on a path (t=1) demonstrates why unrestricted Online-LOCAL(t) can accumulate long-range mutable state that breaks the color-phased simulation. The main open technical direction is a tree-specific “state-elimination” program (start with paths t=1, prove a canonical interface on ∂B(v,2t) or exhibit a separating LCL). Files cited: prover-01.out.json, prover-02.out.json; refs: Akbari et al. (ICALP’23), Theorem 2.33 (tree LCL classification).
highlights: Theorem A (archived) correctly gives O(log* n) LOCAL for order-robust r-local sequential algorithms that read B(v,r) and write only at v.

There are two different "online" models: (1) order-robust r-local sequential (handled already), and (2) the Online-LOCAL(t) of Akbari et al. (ICALP’23); the latter allows accumulated long-range state across many arrivals.

Definition and lemma: output-only Online-LOCAL(t) (and equivalently t-local-dependence) were introduced; Lemma O1/Bridge shows such an online algorithm yields an order-robust r-local sequential rule with r=t, so Theorem A applies.

Concrete counter-scenario on a path (t=1): repeated arrivals can propagate information one hop per arrival and imprint far-away state into B(v,1) before v arrives — a color-phased simulation that only grants O(1) rounds cannot reproduce this.

State-elimination target: conjecture that on bounded-degree trees (start with paths) any deterministic Online-LOCAL(t) can be transformed into an output-only/t-local-dependence form by showing that the interface ∂B(v,2t) admits a canonical, finite summary depending only on final outputs in B(v,2t).
Alternative contingency: if state-elimination fails, attempt to build an LCL on trees that separates Online-LOCAL(t) from order-robust sequential rules (or show impossibility guided by Theorem 2.33).
next_questions: Formalize and write a rigorous proof of Lemma O1 (output-only / t-local-dependence ⇒ order-robust r-local sequential) and add it to output.md.

Carry out the path (chain) case for t=1: define the annulus R = B(v,2)\B(v,1) and prove (or disprove) that agreement on outputs in B(v,2) forces the same feasible outputs for v (state-elimination on paths).

Depending on the path outcome, either (a) generalize the interface argument to trees and t>1, or (b) attempt to construct a separating LCL on trees that exploits accumulated mutable state in Online-LOCAL(t).
